title: How to Fold a Napkin Into a Bunny

steps.headline: Use the right napkin.
steps.description: For this to work best, the napkin should be large and square. It can be paper or cloth, but shouldn't be limp, so cloth may need to be starched lightly. Ensure that the cloth is crease-free too.

steps.headline: Place the napkin down on a work surface, opened out to its full square.
Fold the napkin in half.
steps.description: Bring the top edge to the bottom edge.

steps.headline: Repeat the fold again.
steps.description: As before, bring the top edge to the bottom edge.

steps.headline: Bring each side to meet in the middle and fold down.
Fold the bottom right edges to the middle crease.
Fold the right side in half.
steps.description: This brings the right side to the center, forming an ear.

steps.headline: Fold the pointed triangle at the top down.
Slip the right top point into the pocket formed on the left.
Turn the napkin right side up.

tyn: Napkin (paper or stiff cloth) in an exact square
text: Use the right napkin. For this to work best, the napkin should be large and square. It can be paper or cloth, but shouldn't be limp, so cloth may need to be starched lightly. Ensure that the cloth is crease-free too. Place the napkin down on a work surface, opened out to its full square.  Fold the napkin in half. Bring the top edge to the bottom edge. Repeat the fold again. As before, bring the top edge to the bottom edge. Bring each side to meet in the middle and fold down.  Fold the bottom right edges to the middle crease.  Fold the right side in half. This brings the right side to the center, forming an ear. Repeat with the left side.  Fold the pointed triangle at the top down.  Slip the right top point into the pocket formed on the left.  Turn the napkin right side up. The rabbit's ears will appear. Place on display.
sentences: For this to work best, the napkin should be large and square.
It can be paper or cloth, but shouldn't be limp, so cloth may need to be starched lightly.
Ensure that the cloth is crease-free too.
Place the napkin down on a work surface, opened out to its full square.
Bring the top edge to the bottom edge.
As before, bring the top edge to the bottom edge.
Bring each side to meet in the middle and fold down.
Fold the bottom right edges to the middle crease.
Fold the right side in half.
This brings the right side to the center, forming an ear.
Fold the pointed triangle at the top down.
Slip the right top point into the pocket formed on the left.
Turn the napkin right side up.
